pros: Great way to make some extra cash while studying and bonus if you love math. Love the teachers.
cons: Some teachers have different standards and methods to follow, but otherwise no complaints!

pros: Great people, mission driven, Christmas vacation time
cons: Sometimes being asked to do a lot with little resources is not the answer

review_title: Atmosphere: great; pay level: not so great. Health plan is sub standard.
pros: The people here seem really committed to the students and the students are as nice and smart as any at other larger universities where I've worked. The work is engaging and they mostly give you the tools you need to do your job well.
cons: A lot of the people who work here have been here forever and they have their little fiefdoms from which they can put up roadblocks at whim. Also, the pay is substandard and the raises for staff do not keep up with inflation, so you essentially take a least a small pay cut every year you get only the standard merit raise. Parking is very expensive for a non-commuter school in a city with a bad transportation system. Lower paid folks pay a higher percentage of their income for parking passes than do the highest paid faculty and high-level administrators. Health plan co-pays are through the roof!

review_title: Assessment of New Patient and Coordinating 3rd and 4th Year Student requirements
job_title: Patient Care Coordinator II in Omaha, NE
pros: Always rewarding to work with faculty and student. Sick time and PTO are separate. Great health care/dental plan/vision
cons: Challenging to find patient candidates with the proper dental requirements to keep dental student schedules full. Micro Management is an on going issue. Low paying salary

review_title: "Senior" management is creating a revolving door
job_title: Desktop Support Technician in Omaha, NE
pros: Great direct managers, a vast array of technology (healthcare, business, design etc.) you'll get/have to support.
cons: The best way to portray the challenges you will face would be to state that 95% of upper-management have never completed a single IT ticket, nor would they be able to. Pay is laughable, have to pay for parking, minuscule pay raises, little to no advancement, CompTIA Certifications are no longer offered, travel to remote locations (Bergan, Immanuel, etc) without reimbursement for gas or vehicle damage, they will force you to use your mobile phone in your day-to-day but will not cover any of the charges, and you will have a massive workload as a field tech with little pay and high stress

pros: Fine, consistent, compensation average, good online library
cons: Bad health insurance, only cover half of usmle step 3 cost

review_title: High Expectations, Low Compensation, No Communication
pros: I had a really excellent supervisor A small handful of my coworkers are outstanding people
cons: This place crushed my spirit Devoted to hierarchy above all else Discriminatory workplace Understaffed--hires and refuses to fire incompetent people Expectations are constantly increasing while compensation doesn't even meet cost of living Lots of wasted time/energy expected of you Only the lowest in the hierarchy are expected to communicate anything Any critical feedback gets laughed off and complimentary inflated Very cliquey, and those cliques will shout down progress Extremely disparate expectations between people in the same positions Have to spend a lot of time coddling the feelings of those above you to get anywhere Public statistics from survey of employees: Analyses revealed statistically significant differences based on position status(Exempt, Non-Exempt), years employed at Creighton, spiritual affiliation, and disability status. Thirty-six percent (n =338) of Staff respondents felt that the performance evaluation process was productive (p. 200) and 27% (n= 247) felt that clear procedures existed on how they could advance at Creighton (p. 223). Less than half of Staff respondents felt Creighton provided adequate support to help them manage work-life balance (48%, n= 447, p. 202). Half of Staff respondents felt that Creighton policies (e.g., Family Medical Leave Act) were fairly applied across Creighton (49%, n= 451, p. 214). Twenty percent (n= 199) of Staff respondents felt staff salaries were competitive (p. 217). Half of Staff respondents (49%, n= 459) indicated that their workload increased without additional compensation as a result of other staff departures(p. 205). Over half of Staff respondents(52%, n =483) indicated that a hierarchy existed within staff positions that allowed some voices to be valued more than others(p. 206).Less than half of Staff respondents felt that Creighton committees(39%, n =358, p. 221), Creighton faculty (35%, n =317, p. 221), and senior administrators(40%, n =367, p. 221) valued staff opinions

pros: Relaxed, good benefits, great people to work with
cons: Parking situation is really horrible

pros: Great to get involved on campus and with other students
cons: Omaha is very hot in the summer

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros: Great place to work. Lots of friendly people who are very helpful.
cons: People can form cliques because of the smaller environment.

pros: Creighton has fairly good mid upper management lately but top VPs are another story.
cons: Biggest con is salary is much lower than average which is the main reason they have such high turnover the past 5 years. Some new positions are getting respectable salaries--good thing because promotions aren't common and yearly increases are poor.

review_title: They live their mission of caring for others.

pros: Culture. Great people to work with! They are flexible with work schedule for most people.
cons: Most jobs are paid less than the private sector.

review_title: Great job to have while in school!
pros: Loved the flexibility of my work schedule.
cons: Need to be good at time management!

job_title: Call Center Representative in Omaha, NE
pros: I can do schoolwork while I work on my job
cons: Can be hard for introverted people since the job is being on the phone

pros: generous PTO and sick time
cons: Staff salary is low which impacts retention

pros: Benefits Package Beautiful campus Students
cons: Welcoming does not equal being inclusive

review_title: Revolving Door due to Poor Leadership
pros: Great place for students to study
cons: Don’t care about staff well-being or satisfaction. Management has poor leadership skills in most divisions. Most leadership is stuck in the old-school mentality that you must be in the office for it to be considered working (no work from home), salaried staff means working 50+ hours per week, very few raises, compensation package is horrendous.

pros: nice coworker life-work balance good management
cons: Nothing not happy with, not applied

pros: Full room and board is covered.
cons: Heavy workload with lots of stressors.

job_title: Senior Research Scientist in Omaha, NE
pros: More holidays, good 401k, and medical insurance
cons: Not very good environment for research

pros: Greta work life Balance and greta people
cons: Low pay and losing people to other companies

pros: It is a really beautiful workspace and many of the people who work there are great!
cons:
-No guaranteed annual raise- even if you are a top performer
-It costs an extra $120 a month if your spouse is employed and you choose to put them on Creighton insurance. 
-Little direction for upward advancement 
-Extremely inconsistent WFH opportunities between employees with equal title and responsibilities.
-You must work many nights and weekends. You are told in your interview this time can be made up elsewhere, but only certain employees were allowed to take their comped time.

job_title: Front Desk Receptionist in Omaha, NE
pros: Very Friendly Staff and Students.
cons: Odd Hours that ranged from 2am-4am.

review_title: Lovely Place to Work, Please Increase Pay/Benefits
job_title: Research Laboratory Technician II in Omaha, NE
pros:
- Flexible hours (this highly depends on the PI of the laboratory)
- Tuition remission (to take courses while working)
- Collaborative work environment, 99% of people will help you learn and improve
- Many opportunities to network and build professional career in any direction you desire (for professional or graduate school, in academia, etc.)
cons:
- Low base pay (expected of grant-funded positions), I made $16-$17 per hour for my entire time here
- Benefits (outside of tuition remission) are not very good. Healthcare insurance is through United Healthcare, which does not cover and many times the copay is ridiculously expensive for annual physical exams/labs despite being on the more expensive PPO plan.
- Variable schedule near lab crunch time (journal submission, conference presentations, etc.) you will often work 50-60 hour weeks, again, this depends on the laboratory/PI.
- The Animal Resources Facility (ARF) currently appears underfunded by Creighton; low pay ($16 per hour for ARF technicians) means it has been hard to retain/hire staff to help maintain lab mouse colonies, which makes it harder for laboratories
- As of 2022, terrible parking for staff around the Criss science building cluster. Also you will likely need to pay for parking (an amount is deducted from paycheck based on your pay) if you come to work after 7am. You can park very far away and take a Creighton shuttle to get to the Criss buildings, but frankly that's a ridiculous amount of effort for staff and faculty that are paying money for parking.

pros: The people are fantastic. You receive a paid week off between Christmas and the first business day of the new year.
cons: Pay is below industry standards for all positions below top leadership. Health insurance is expensive. Zero room for career growth. No real policies so bad managers/employees are not held accountable.

review_title: Great people, low pay and advancement opportunities
pros: Great, supportive people. Flexible and great work/life balance and time off
cons: Low pay, not many advancement opportunities

job_title: Maintenace Tech II in Omaha, NE
pros: People you work with are great.
cons: The post is below standard

review_title: Time off makes up for lack of pay, but only for a short time.
pros: Benefits are good, and time off is great since you get holidays such as Good Friday, Juneteenth, MLK day and the week off between Christmas and NY.
cons:
Pay does not compare to market value. 
If promoted, there's a 10% increase rule so it's better to search elsewhere than to take a promotion most of the time.

pros: Flexible work time and locations
cons: Pay is too low and increase too slow

pros: The creative suite served as a great first job, giving me the opportunity to practice learning whatever I wanted, and the chance to develop strong business-world skills, like emailing clients and working within due dates for project-based work.
cons: Honestly, I can't really think of any. Projects slowed down a lot during covid and didn't really pick up again until my last month of work.

pros: Great supervisor, enjoyed working with my team, grew a lot professionally

cons: The work environment was old school and not pleasant. There were numerous inappropriate comments made around me and to me that made me feel uncomfortable. I wasn't there for long because I knew I couldn't progress in my career there. The work was tedious and extremely manual.

pros: There are truly good people that work here. They do give some great benefits,  like the Christmas break and free tuition for Creighton.
cons: Work life balance,  at least for my area,  is not there. Expectations and demands don't meet the pay.   Seems that people get put in positions based on degrees and not ability.   A lot of people in positions they cannot do but due to a degree they just are able to delegate what they can't do. ..which is most of their work.   Creighton continuously reminds you of every thing at they give you and that you won't find a better work place.  They also try and make you feel guilty for being paid because they apparently are always worried about money. You spend a lot of time reviewing your responsibilities and documenting how you spend your day,  but nobody can tell you why they always want to know.

pros: There is a great community that wants to impact the world.
cons: There are not cons present.

review_title: Creighton University Department of Physical Therapy
job_title: Physical Therapist in New York, NY
pros: Community, Challenging, Service, Mentorship, Leaders In Field.
cons: Cost of Education, in Omaha.

pros: good students to have class with
cons: Weather is not very pleasant

pros: Great education benefits, IF you are there long enough to be eligible to use them.  Generally, good people working there.  Strong Catholic environment for those who like that.  Closed over Christmas.
cons: Very poor leadership in a time of budget crisis.  Staff was targeted for cuts, but did not know what was happening, or what to expect.  Every day you went to work, you expected that you or someone else in your department could be cut without notice.  No consideration for the workload that remaining staff would be expected to absorb, or the stress that those who remained would endure.  Hit-or-miss training for department managers on how to effectively lead their teams.  Some were great, while some were lousy.  Very limited opportunities to advance once you obtained an entry-level position.  Pay and benefits below average for the Omaha market.

review_title: Great place to work, if I was planning to retire in the next decade
pros:
Great people work here; I felt like part of the family everyday when I got to work.  
I loved my manager and senior management;  they are great people.  
Benefits were great: I got a masters degree essentially for free; paid time off and holidays are fantastic. 
Flexibility in work hours for many positions.
cons:
Average employee age is approximately 50-55. Ideas from those under the age of 40 are ignored; I was told that I was "too young" several times when presenting ideas.  Good 'ol boys club is alive and well here.  
Afraid of change. 
Salaries are well-below average; benefits are suppose to make up for low pay. (I make $10,000 more now after a lateral move).
There is no potential for promotion or advancement for 99% of positions.  
Decisions from management take 3-6+ months.

review_title: A crapshoot with respect to satisfaction; not up to image
pros:
Being a part of a university that gives a great education to students
Interaction with students is usually positive
Beautiful physical environment, i.e., campus
Opportunities to advance one's own education
Free tuition for sons & daughters of CU employees
When your supervisor and coworkers have good people skills, working there is great
cons:
The oft-used phrase "Creighton Family" reminds me of John Bradshaw's books, especially "Family Secrets: What You Don't Know CAN Hurt You"
Small departments (few subordinates per supervisor) means people may be afraid to speak up even with constructive suggestions
Some supervisory intimidation leads office staff to stress out
Complaining about your boss (for legitimate reasons) yields only retaliation
Authoritarian management gets carried away sometimes, such as onerous performance evaluation system that is a distraction from rather than a stimulant to doing one's job
You're likelier to be happier working in an academic (except professional schools) than administrative department, especially as a faculty member - they're treated better

review_title: Good place to work - but definitely a ceiling
job_title: Communications and Marketing Strategist in Omaha, NE
pros: Creighton has a pretty positive culture and overall (at least in my department) allows for a healthy work/life balance.  A lot of people have worked at Creighton for 20+ years, but it still remains relatively progressive compared to other higher education e
cons:
The departments across campus are very siloed, so getting things done cross-departmentally can be very tedious. Also, there is not a lot of room for advancement because there are very few "middle management" type positions, so you are either staff, faculty, or leadership - there is pretty much no in between. Because of that - and because tuition and enrollment have such a large impact on 
 budgets - salaries are good, but not great, and any raise you receive is going to basically just be a "cost of living" raise.

pros: People can be great, depending on what department, school, college or division you work in.
cons: Too much variation in management style from place to place. Top-heavy - there are at least 100 kinds of provost, vice-presidents and executive directors. Ego is unavoidable, evidenced by a private bathroom for a VP, an executive director who claims to need three offices, deans who want Macs for clerical staff when Windows boxes would be have the cost, and so-called revenue producers who use corporate credit cards to get around policy. To be clear, nothing at all sketchy in a criminal sense. Just human nature running to petty excess, like leaks you decide to live with rather than fix.

review_title: Probably the worst Job I ever had
pros: PTO, free food, working with peers who wouldn't work with you.
cons: Where to start? If you want to proceed in your career, forget that. They will create a roadblock in your every step. Nothing comes easy, you have to earn them. But just because you pay tour employyes don't mean you owe them They not your slaves.  Pay is way way below market standard, so bad that even you feel ashamed to tell anyone what you even make. You hear budjet is tight every year, but that dosen't stop the  top tier to buy new houses every year .  Technology is boring, employees don't even get training on new technologies. It's a roadblock for you to stop leaving  . Good try. As a technical person, you will probably feel lost in the open world. Stay away. Your only way of survivavl here is not by how much hard work you do , but by whom you know up the ladder.

review_title: Great co-workers, Good Opportunities, low pay
pros: Overall Creighton is a great place to work. Co-workers treat each other like family, most managers reward employees for hard work, recognition is common across the campus, there are opportunities for advancement within most departments and across the university. The environment is very collaborative and innovative. The benefits are very good- especially the vacation time, retirement contributions, and tuition remission.
cons:
- For some positions, the pay is below the market rate for the Omaha area- taking advantage of tuition remission is a good way to make up for the lower wages. 
- You also have to pay for parking. 
- Some policies are from the turn of the century and need to be updated.

review_title: Important Work but not Always Valued
pros:
Easy going atmosphere with plenty of activities and events on campus.
Tuition discount is excellent if not a little tight.
I was able to get my start in the professional world and slowly gained more responsibilities as I earned the trust of my boss.
cons:
The pay is not fantastic.
The benefits are mediocre which is a shame since there is a hospital, clinic, and dental school all on campus.
Work we do is important and has potential for strong impact but is often seen as an afterthought to the current moment/life situation of employee or boss. I wish that professionalism was stressed more than it is.

review_title: Right hand doesn't know what the left is doing.
pros: Love working with students and staff; most faculty are great too. Depending on department you are in hours can be flexible which is another perk.
cons: NO communication between management & staff; very top heavy, too many chefs making the soup. Raises are non-existent or so small (1-2%) that if you work here for more than a couple of years you are paid less than the new person just hired.

pros: The University as a whole is awesome at promoting a whole person concept. You will meet people from all walks of life and they are almost always helpful and friendly.
cons: Compensation is lower than most, making it hard to acquire and retain good talent. Some departments on campus still operate in a quite backward fashion, and trying to help them progress is quite painful.

review_title: Great program for GRAs in the College of Business
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Omaha, NE
pros:
You get 1000/month for working 10 hours a week.
You also get compensated for 9 credit hours per year. 
(These numbers could change by year, but you always get at least 6 credit hours paid for, and at least 500/month. It just depends on how many GRAs there are that year and how much money they have budgeted)
You get to set your own schedule with the professor that you are an assistant for.
cons:
You don't always have work to do.... I guess this can be a Pro depending on how you look at it.
Really there are no cons.

job_title: Career and Academic Advisor in Omaha, NE
pros: What I love most about Creighton is the way the campus is infused with the spirit of St. Ignatius, the founder of the Jesuit Order.  The Jesuit priests bring a spirit of ministry to all they do and it is contagious.  Their example of being men and women for and with others in order to give glory to God is inspiring.  As an advisor, I can experience the work I do for and with students as a ministry as well.  This gives a whole new meaning and sense of purpose to my everyday work.  The encouragement I get to express my own faith and grow spiritually here at Creighton is a real blessing.  It enables me to be a better advisor and to feel I am a valuable part of something worthy.  Creighton truly is a community with a glorious mission that I am so honored to be a part of...it is hard now to imagine working anywhere else!
cons: The only element I can think of that approaches a "downside" at Creighton is that I believe salaries are sometimes a little on the low side.  There are fantastic benefits, certainly, but there is still something about earning a salary that is commensurate with talent, experience, longevity and committment that Creighton has not yet managed to put in a place of priority for faculty or staff.  In hard budget times, however, I am grateful to have this job and it is a decent salary.

job_title: Public Safety Dispatcher in Omaha, NE
pros: A good amount of PTO. Sick, Vacation, Holiday and "Snow" days if Creighton Cancels school. Pay is decent for the work you actually do.
cons: In the public safety department, there are no leaders. The day shift supervisor thinks he is everyones boss and tells other employees on other shifts what to do. He lies constantly, and other supervisors act like nothing happens. They say they will have your back, but they never do.

review_title: Love it -- Best job I've had
pros: Caring atmosphere that feels like a family.  May be the Jesuit influence as it's a kinder/gentler place to work.  Thanks CU!!!
cons: Working out of a budget crunch (signs of the time), but they are getting back on track.   Wish benefit package a bit stronger, but so fortunate to have what I've got in these hard times.

pros: Excellent sense of community. Fantastic time off during the holidays. Even if you are not an alum, student or even catholic, you can believe in the Creighton spirit.
cons: difficult to move "up" and often titles are handed out to pacify an employee. Titles that mean very little in terms of a raise or upward movement to management.

pros: I work for the Enrollment Management team. Incredibly value-oriented; great working environment; multiple travel opportunities. If you are a Creighton alum, this is a great opportunity to pay your Creighton experience forward!
cons: The downside is having to work on many weekends and inconsistent work load throughout the year--some weeks you might find to be relaxed, and other times, energy draining. So if you're the kind of person who prefers a fixed schedule, this role might not be a good fit for you.

job_title: Associate Professor of Business in Omaha, NE
pros: Creighton offers a wonderful environment for personal and professional growth. My colleagues and genuinely concerned, warm, well rounded individuals with a high degree of professionalism. The campus facilities are wonderful! The school is committed to the well-being of students, faculty and staff. It's long-term strategic planning is exceptional and it is experiencing healthy growth.
cons: Retirement benefits are less attractive than at other institutions of higher education, which is a grave concern for me.

review_title: I have enjoyed working at Creighton for over 20 years.
pros:
Good coworkers.
Good benefits, especially health care and tuition remission for self and family members.
Able to take classes for a nominal fee.
Able to attend Mass, bible study, and spiritual direction.
Opportunities for employee/career development.
cons:
Salaries are a bit lower than other places.
Workplace satisfaction varies depending on department, school, etc.

pros:
Creighton is a great place to start your career. A small/mid-size school opens up opportunities that may not be available at larger schools.

Creighton offers very competitive salaries
cons:
Lack of visual diversity at the faculty/staff level
Understaffing/stewarding leads to overworking of employees
Campus Politics

pros: Able to work with fellow students and professors to help recruit students to the University.  Able to coordinate work hours around student schedule.
cons: Pay system was stipend based.  Some projects were more data-entry than others, not able to interact very closely with students on recruitment tours.

pros: Not too intense or competitive, focused on a family like environment, utilizing team work and efficiency through working smart rather than hard.
cons: Once people get a job here they stay for a long period of time so it may be difficult to move up, but tuition reimbursement program allows for one to gain more training and greater potential future payoff as well as a great amount of current value.

review_title: Genuinely sincere educators who help students achieve success
pros:
A revered history of graduating remarkably successful students in a wide variety of fields.
Keeps a finger on the pulse of educational innovation.
cons: Salaries for support staff do not keep pace with median salaries in the area.

pros: Incredible environment.  Good benefits.  Great support from leadership.  Students you work with are really passionate about making a positive impact.
cons: I do not see many.  I think the location may limit some diversity, but the University works hard to overcome that.

pros: No micromanagement, large personal office, quiet environment, ability to work independently, interaction with medical students, ok health insurance
cons: no direction, the department is costing the univeristy tons of money and the university refuses to do anything about it, low pay, horrible management, invisible administrator

review_title: Excellent and caring people who help in any way they can
pros: Flexible hours work with most class schedules, an enriching experience, interesting and nice staff, helpful resources, local iJay store for computer and mobile needs when they arise
cons:
Very busy, may be stressful balancing classes and work at times
May not be able to get the exact job you want right away due to conflicts or qualifications

review_title: Overall, A Good Place to Be
pros: Professional Development Opportunities, Care about Mission, Great Students
cons: Very little transparency for strategic vision all while boasting about how transparent they are.

review_title: Pleasant work environment, a bit difficult to advance
pros: Creighton is a nice university setting. Opportunities for employee development. People appreciate the Catholic and Jesuit identity of the university.
cons: Advancement plan for employees is non-existent. It really depends upon whether you can make connections on your own. HR doesn't help out much, but it's small enough that you can make connections if you try.

review_title: Work Study in Medical Microbiology and Immunology Lab
